## Description {#details}

Helper for Errors used as out-parameters.

This helper is for use with the Error-as-out-parameter idiom, where an error is passed to a function or method by reference, rather than being returned. In such cases it is helpful to set the checked bit on entry to the function so that the error can be written to (unchecked Errors abort on assignment) and clear the checked bit on exit so that clients cannot accidentally forget to check the result. This helper performs these actions automatically using RAII:


<ProgramListing extension="cpp">

<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/ms-demangle/#afb795990ffc0cb7321e7d1eacc246324a8eea62084ca7e541d918e823422bd82e">Result</a> foo(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac226f3d2b9ca090171a8e0a8cb92c343a902b0d55fddef6f8d651fe1035b7d4bd">Error</a> &amp;Err) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="#a15601d16c2b77fe4bf989a7790ae1579">ErrorAsOutParameter</a> ErrAsOutParam(&amp;Err); </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#39;Checked&#39; flag set</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &lt;body of foo&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &lt;- &#39;Checked&#39; flag auto-cleared when ErrAsOutParam is destructed.</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>


<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/errorasoutparameter">ErrorAsOutParameter</a> takes an Error&#42; rather than <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a>&amp; so that it can be used with optional Errors (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> pointers that are allowed to be null). If <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/errorasoutparameter">ErrorAsOutParameter</a> took an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> reference, an instance would have to be created inside every condition that verified that <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> was non-null. By taking an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> pointer we can just create one instance at the top of the function.

Definition at line 1130 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/error-h">Error.h</a>.
